posts.post_content:
8 mana for total game domination... this thing can byp\*\*\* most things without leaving a single drawback; besides, he is NICOL BOLAS!  
okok, you're right: 8 mana is a kick in the darn, but well, get this guy into the battlefield and ask gentlemanly to your opponent "do you concede or do I have to make you suffer?".  
Another good point is the non-Nicol Bolas elder dragon-cost (2UUBBRR); but its main problem is that it joins the battle too late, beside that this thing alone can handle your foe whole deck.

Posted By: Weretarrasque (2/11/2010 5:44:48 PM)

posts.post_content:
I remember the first time I saw someone play this card. He played the plainswalker, stole my [Ertie, wizard adept](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ertie, wizard adept) and ended his turn. I took my turn, [Confiscate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Confiscate)ed Nico, and used him to steal my Ertie back. I ended the game shortly there after. (Me stealing the most expensive planswalker in the game sent me on a power trip of a week)  
  
Ironically, I later got the card from him, so I now own it. (Thought he didn't need it after he got Jace, the mind sculptor, though I still had to trade half a deck for it).   
  
I will admit, he is harder to summon than I thought. Although, I did underestimate his ultimate; the first time I got him out I used it. This left my opponent with an empty hand, two lands left on the field, and Zero life. (Another week long power trip)  
  
So at any rate, His plus ability is nice, at worst, it disarms your opponent by killing his lands. At best, he just ate your opponent's with twelve loyalty counters... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content: @Ladnarud: We could all go on and on talking about how this card falls to card A,B,C etc... We all know that, THAT IS THE POINT OF MAGIC!!!! Every card in magic has some sort of way to defeat it, we all know this. I can't stand people you just post comments for a card saying "Oh this card sucks because it dies to 1,000 removal spells." SO DOES EVERY CARD IN MAGIC!!!!!! That is what makes this game so great. There are no perfect strategies, there is always a way around your opponenets threats and there will always be ways for your opponenet to get around your threats. Thats why we all love playing magic, its ever-evolving and you must always be ready to problem-solve and to think outside of the box.

posts.post_content:
Lol... all those Timmys out there raving about Bolas make me facepalm.  
  
[Vindicate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vindicate). [Vampire Hexmage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vampire Hexmage). [Commandeer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Commandeer). [Willbender](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Willbender) his +3 ability to himself. Even a [Lightning Bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Bolt) if you're stupid enough to use his -2 ability the turn he comes out.  
  
Good planeswalker though if you have the mana for him and the resources to protect and use him.

posts.post_content:
Did you know that once you play the planeswalker, ***then*** you put their loyalty counters on them? So if you play... say... [doubling season](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=doubling season) a turn before... He comes into play with 10 counters. And you can just jump straight to his ultimate. And considering G has the best cards for manafixing, it should be no problem to get to his color cost.
  
Have a nice day.
